data.title: Facebook Announces $40M In Grants For Small US Businesses Affected By Coronavirus
data.text: Facebook Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) is dedicating $40 million to help small businesses across the United States weather the novel coronavirus pandemic.

data.title: Why Facebook Stock Fell 13.3% in March
data.text: Usage went up, but advertising is down.

data.title: Facebook Says It Will Hire 10,000 in 2020
data.text: Facebook is looking to beef up its engineering and product teams.

data.title: 3 Low-Debt Stocks to Buy Before a Seemingly Inevitable Recession
data.text: With a recession all but certain, investors should be loading their portfolio with low-debt stocks that have a strong position to weather the storm.

data.title: Facebook (FB) Launches Messenger for Windows and Mac Desktop
data.text: Facebook (FB) releases Messenger App For Windows and MacOS as usage of desktop browser increases 100% amid coronavirus-induced lockdown.

data.title: Is this crisis actually helping to boost Facebook’s image? It’s complicated
data.text:
The social network’s emotional new ad illustrates how it’s helping people feel less isolated.
This week Facebook joined the chorus of recent brand advertising aimed at reflecting and inspiring solidarity, empathy, resolve—and just a bit of brand loyalty—among us all amid this crisis.

data.title: Facebook Wants to Take a Bite Out of Zoom Video's Growth
data.text: The social networking giant is making it easier to use Messenger on the desktop for both video calling and text conversations.

data.title: Got $2,500? Here Are 5 High-Growth Stocks to Buy Now
data.text: The coronavirus crash has created an attractive entry point for these five fast-growing businesses.

data.title: Facebook Plans To Hire 10,000 Employees, Announces Measures To Support Small Businesses Fighting Pandemic
data.text: Facebook Inc.’s (NASDAQ: FB) COO Sheryl Sandberg said that the social media giant would hire 10,000 additional workers for its product and engineering teams by the end of 2020.

data.title: Facebook Plans To Hire 10,000 Employees By The End Of The Year
data.text: Facebook Inc.’s (NASDAQ: FB) COO Sheryl Sandberg said that the social media giant would hire 10,000 additional workers for its product and engineering teams by the end of 2020.
